alert.note: Alert for Central Black Hills; Northern Black Hills; Southern Black Hills (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 22 at 2:27AM MST until December 23 at 5:00PM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...EXTREME COLD AND DANGEROUS WIND CHILLS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH FRIDAY... ...TRAVEL IMPACTS DUE TO BLOWING SNOW THROUGH FRIDAY... .Strong gusty winds will persist across much of the area through early Friday, with the strongest winds expected Thursday afternoon and evening. The combination of wind and freshly fallen snowfall from Wednesday will result in blowing snow and blizzard or near blizzard conditions at times across the northwest into west central South Dakota plains. Areas of blowing snow can be expected elsewhere on the plains, with reduced visibilities at times, especially on Thursday. Dangerously cold wind chills will continue over western South Dakota and northeastern Wyoming through the week. The coldest wind chills are expected this morning through Friday morning, with values of 30 below to near 60 below zero in most areas through Friday morning. ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 65 below zero. * WHERE...In South Dakota, the Northern Black Hills, the Central Black Hills and the Southern Black Hills. In Wyoming, Southern Campbell County and the Weston County Plains. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Warning means the combination of wind and cold temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. Even if you are outdoors for just a few minutes, cover all parts of your body, especially your head, face, and hands.

area.areaDesc: Central Black Hills; Northern Black Hills; Southern Black Hills
